Dear Suzette Finney:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the Program Manager Claudia Triestram 616-552-3662.

Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check; subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 5/09/23, a staff member and their significant other
smoked marijuana with a youth outside of the facility.
Investigation This complaint was received on 05/12/2023 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Chief Administrator/Complainant on 05/12/2023 at
the facility, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. She reported
on 05/11/2023 Youth A disclosed that few days ago Staff 1’s
boyfriend came to the facility. Youth A and Staff 1 went outside,
they all played soccer, Staff 1 and her boyfriend smoked
marijuana and encouraged Youth A to smoke marijuana. Staff 1
has been put on administrative leave pending the investigation.
Staff 1 has only been working at the facility since 04/03/2023 and
had completed all her new hire training. The facility has a zero-
tolerance policy for staff smoking/substances/vaping on the
property or using substances. Youth A is on 1;1 supervision and is
doing on-line school due to her behavior and drug use. A drug
screen was completed on Youth A yesterday and results are
pending.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 05/12/2023, in collaboration
with MDDHS Specialist. Youth A is 17 years old, and she has
been at the facility for 2 years. Youth A is currently enrolled in on-
line school. Youth A reported she told staff on 05/11/2023 that
Staff 1’s boyfriend came to the facility, and they all smoked
marijuana outside. Youth A said she was pressured by Staff 1 to
smoke marijuana. Youth A could not remember the date this
occurred, but said it was a few days ago and it occurred in the
evening. Youth A said Staff 3 was at the facility, but they were
inside and did not see them smoking marijuana. She felt high
afterwards and was anxious that Staff 3 would notice. Youth A
said she decided to tell staff because she went off site to have
dinner at her friend’s house and was afraid that if she is drug
screened, she would test positive for marijuana. Youth A said
there was also another incident were Staff 1 allowed her to use
her nicotine vape pen. Youth A said Staff 1 used a vape pen
2

several times while supervising her. Youth A said she never told
anyone until yesterday about the marijuana and the vape pen.
Youth A did not express any concerns regarding any other staff.
I interviewed Supervisor at the facility on 05/12/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor has been
working at the facility for 6 months. Supervisor said prior to this
incident she has not had any concerns with Staff 1. She said on
05/11/2023 Youth A reported to her that Staff 1’s boyfriend came
to the facility and Staff 1 made her smoke marijuana. Supervisor
called Staff 1 yesterday and Staff 1 denied that her boyfriend
came to the facility. Staff 1 did not deny giving Youth A marijuana
but said that Youth A was stressed and anxious. Supervisor said
she has never observed Staff 1 to be under the influence.
I interviewed Staff 1 via telephone on 05/15/2023. Staff 1 reported
she has only been at the facility for one month and has completed
all her training. Staff 1 denied using marijuana but admitted to
using a nicotine vape. Staff 1 admitted that her boyfriend came to
the facility last week on 05/09/2023, but he did not come inside
the facility. She denied smoking marijuana or pressuring Youth A
to smoke marijuana. Staff 1 admitted that she has a nicotine vape
pen and that Youth A had taken without her permission. She said
it was on 05/09/2023 that she caught Youth A using her vape pen.
She admitted that she should not have a vape pen while on shift
and said that was the only mistake she made. She knows it is
against facility policy to be using a vape pen while on the job.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 05/30/2023. Staff 2 has
worked at the facility for 6 months. Staff 2 reported she has never
witnessed Staff 1 using a vape pen or smoking marijuana while on
the job.
I interviewed Staff 3 via telephone on 06/08/2023. Staff 3 has
been working at the facility for 3 months. Staff 3 was working on
05/09/2023 with Staff 1. She said Staff 1’s boyfriend came on his
motorcycle to the facility, but he did not come inside the facility.
She said Youth A was outside with Staff 1 and her boyfriend. She
said they were outside for approximately one hour. Staff 1 denied
smelling or observing Staff 1 and Youth A to be under the
influence. Staff 1 denied ever seeing Staff 1 to be under the
influence of any drugs and never witnessed Staff 1 giving a vape
pen to Youth A.
MIC Predisposition conference held on 06/09/2023 with MDHHS
Specialist and Supervisor with an outcome of no findings.
3

Documents reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 05/11/2023. On 05/11/2023 Youth A
reported that a few days ago Staff 1’s boyfriend came to
the facility and she and Staff 1 played soccer. Staff 1
smoked marijuana with her boyfriend and encouraged
Youth A to smoke marijuana. Employee was suspended
pending an investigation.
• Drug screen summary dated 05/11/2023, Youth A tested
negative for all drugs.
• Staff 1’s Employment termination letter dated 05/30/2023.
Analysis The facility is non-complaint as there is evidence staff allowed the
youth to use her vape pen, but it could not be determined if Staff
allowed youth to smoke marijuana. Staff 1 admitted having her
vape pen accessible to the youth but denied smoking or allowing
youth to smoke marijuana. Youth A drug screen was negative for
all drugs.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Privacy and confidentiality.
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff allowed her boyfriend to come to the facility and permitting
him to have contact with the youth.
Investigation Staff 1 admitted that her boyfriend came to the facility and had
contact with youths at the facility.
Youth A reported Staff 1’s boyfriend came to the facility and Youth
A played outside with Staff 1 and her boyfriend.
Analysis The facility is non-complaint with the rule as there is evidence staff
allowed a community member to know the identity of youth placed
at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
